quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Constitution and Europe
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, balloons, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The worlds first constitution was the American one. Which constitution was the second in the world and the first in Europe?
When did the first large balloons replace real animals at the Macys Parade?
This was the first family to have two members who got the Nobel Prize in the same year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Curies

questions.question: What was the first European city to have a complex sewage disposal system?
Who was the first explorer to reach both the North and the South Poles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roald Amundsen

questions.question: Who made the first four-wheeled automobile powered by gasoline?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Karl Benz

questions.question: Soccers home is Europe. Which two teams played the first official international game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: England vs. Scotland

questions.question: The very first Macys Parade was took place in 1923.
Were the new balloons in the 2006 Macy’s parade the Flying Ace Snoopy and an updated version of Pikachu?
The calendar we use today is called Gregorian and was introduced in 1582. Which of these countries was among the first to implement it?
For how long is the Macys Thanksgiving Day Parade usually televised?
What was the first balloon in the Macys parade to be modeled after a living person?
Who made the first transatlantic radio transmission?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guglielmo Marconi

questions.question: Tetris is a popular computer game with hundreds of versions. Who designed and programmed the original game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alexey Pajitnov

questions.question: Who were the first Europeans allowed to trade with Japan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Dutch

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Place and Terrorists
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, kamikaze, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which historical figure is referred to as the Father of Texas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stephen F. Austin

questions.question: What does the word kamikaze mean in Japanese?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Divine wind

questions.question: Dr. Charles R. Drew, who developed a system for storing blood and is known as The Father of the Blood Bank , bled to death after being denied help at a whites only hospital.
192 people died and 2,050 were wounded in the Madrid train bombings in 2004. What part of the day was it, when the tragic event took place?
On September 11, 2001 the four hijacked flights were United Airlines Flight 93, American Airlines Flight 77, American Airlines Flight 11 and which other flight?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: United Airlines Flight 175

questions.question: What is the origin of the name al-Qaeda, the terrorist organization responsible for the 9/11 attacks in the USA?

options.text: The name of an Islamic spiritual leader
A computer database of trained fighters

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A computer database of trained fighters

questions.question: The Beslan school siege in which 186 children were killed by Chechen terrorists took place in what year?
Which terrorist organization was responsible for the bombings of the U.S. embassy in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania and Nairobi, Kenya on August 7, 1998?
This play was shown at the Moscow theatre when Chechen terrorists took the audience hostage on October 23, 2002.
What is the state motto of Texas, also called The Lone Star State?
In 2005 three bombs exploded in the London Underground killing 52 and injuring 700. This first kamikaze attack in Western Europe took place in which month?
Who was the perpetrator of the Oklahoma City bombing on April 19, 1995?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Timothy McVeigh

questions.question: The following lines are from a poem written by this author who was part of the Harlem Renaissance:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Langston Hughes

questions.question: An alternative to Macy’s Thanksgiving Parade is featured in Stamford, Ct. This parade contains balloons that have been retired from the Macys Parade.
How many were the terrorists who hijacked the four airliners and carried out the September 11 attacks on the World Trade Center and the Pentagon?

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Texas and State
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, leader, geronimo. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Sam Houston, who was President of the Republic of Texas, Senator for the State of Texas and later its governor, was born in 1793 in which state?
The 14ers are a coveted goal for many an aspiring hikesr. Colorado has over 30 of these, topping out with this Rocky Mountain monster elevated at 14,433 ft (4 399.m) Name this behemoth.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mt. Elburt

questions.question: Cheyenne Chief Black Kettle and his band were attacked by the U.S. Cavalry on November 27, 1868. This bloody massacre remained in history under what name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Battle of Washita River

questions.question: How many were The Old Three Hundred, the families which settled in south Texas and formed the first Anglo-American colony there?
Big Tex, the 16-meter tall icon of the State Fair of Texas, wears what brand of denim jeans?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lee jeans

questions.question: This Native American chief of the Nez Perce tribe, called by the press the Red Napoleon, was a renowned peacemaker. He is famous for his words: I am tired of fighting.... From where the sun now stands I will fight no more forever.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chief Joseph

questions.question: Which one of these Native American warriors did not participate in the Battle of Little Bighorn in June 1876?
Chief Red Cloud led the most successful Native American war against the U.S. military and forced the Government to sign the Treaty of Fort Laramie.
Which song was selected in 1929 as the official state song of Texas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Texas, Our Texas

questions.question: Chief Goyathlay, generally known as Geronimo, was a prominent leader of the last major independent Native American warriors, who refused to surrender to the U.S. government. Which tribe did he belong to?
On July 20, 1969, Houston was the first word ever spoken from the Moon by which member of the Appolo 11 mission?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neil Armstrong

questions.question: Which one of these American entertainers was not born in Texas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tommy Lee

questions.question: After gaining its independence from Mexico, the Republic of Texas existed for what period of time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: From 1836 to 1845

questions.question: This warrior, who led the Seminole resistance in Florida during the Second Seminole War, was captured by deceit and died in 1838.
The population of which city in Texas does not exceed 1 million?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Slogan and Region
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, chicken, nixons. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Democrats countered Barry Goldwaters 1964 slogan of In Your Heart You Know Hes Right with which of these rejoinders?

options.text: In Your Ear, He Speaks Only Fear
In Your Guts, You Know Hes Nuts
In Your Spleen, You Know Hes Mean
In Your Colon, You Know Hes Rollin

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In Your Guts, You Know Hes Nuts

questions.question: French is an official language (de facto) in the State of Louisiana.
Finish this slogan used against the GOP presidential candidate in 1884: Blaine, Blaine, James G. Blaine ... .

options.text: ... what have we done to deserve such pain?
... who first slew Abel and then murdered Cain
... the continental liar from the state of Maine
... who will sell all our possessions to the King of Spain

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ... the continental liar from the state of Maine

questions.question: In which region was Marquis de La Fayette born?
Which French actress won the 1997 Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Juliette Binoche

questions.question: In which region was Marquis de Montcalm born?
The slogan Tippecanoe and Tyler Too was used by which presidential candidate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Henry Harrison

questions.question: What was the maiden name of Jacqueline Kennedy who was of French descent?
In 1968, the Republican slogan Nixons the One was used by some Democrats on posters bearing the photograph of a pregnant African-American woman.
The slogan A Chicken in Every Pot and a Car in Every Garage was used in the presidential election of Calvin Coolidge in 1924.
Which French actress won the 1959 Academy Award for Best Actress in a Leading Role?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Simone Signoret

questions.question: Dont Swap Horses in the Middle of the Stream was a slogan used in which presidents re-election campaign?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Abraham Lincolns

questions.question: Had Enough? was the slogan used against which president?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harry Truman

questions.question: A Choice, Not an Echo was the slogan of Republicans opposed to what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The New Deal Reforms

questions.question: The phrase Vote Yourself a Farm was used in which US presidential election?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Mount Rushmore and Titanic
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, sail. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How long was the Titanic?
What state is Mount Rushmore in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South Dakota

questions.question: What year was Mount Rushmore officially dedicated?
Did the Titanic have any sister ships?
How many passengers were on the Titanic when she sank?
About how many people visited Mount Rushmore in 2004?
Which of these was one of the leaders of the expedition that discovered the wreck of the Titanic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Ballard

questions.question: There was a person aboard the Titanic named J. Dawson.
There is a vault located behind the carved faces in Mount Rushmore.
Was the original plan followed when carving Mount Rushmore?
Fourteen people died and several others were injured while Mount Rushmore was being sculpted.
The four presidents whose heads are carved in Mount Rushmore are George Washington, Thomas Jefferson, Abraham Lincoln and Franklin Roosevelt.
How long did it take for the Titanic to sink?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2 hours, 40 minutes

questions.question: The Titanic was built by the Harcourt and Wolff shipbuilding firm.
The RMS Titanic set sail from Southampton, England on what date?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Tower and Pisa
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, staffed, weight. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This author who wrote the novel Get Shorty, was born on 11 October 1925, in New Orleans.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elmore Leonard

questions.question: About how many years did the Tower of Pisa take to build?
On 11 October 1968, the first staffed Apollo mission, Apollo 7, was launched. Which of the following was NOT an astronaut on that mission?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neil Armstrong

questions.question: The death toll from a yellow fever epidemic, transferred by brown rats, hit 100 on 11 October 1793 in Philadelphia.
Who was the first guest host of Saturday Night Live on the shows premiere on October 11th, 1975?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Carlin

questions.question: Which former US president  won the Nobel Peace Prize on 11 October 2002?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Carter

questions.question: The Tower of Pisa has over 300 steps inside.
Approximately how high is the Tower of Pisa?
In what direction does the Tower of Pisa lean?
On 11 October 1942, the United States defeated this country in the Battle of Esperance.
How many bells are housed in the the Tower of Pisa?
The estimated weight of the Tower of Pisa is over 16,000 metric tons.
The Tower of Pisa was closed for over a decade due to reconstruction.
On October 11th, 1984, Kathryn Sullivan, became the first American woman to walk in space.
Which former president and first lady got married on October 11th?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William  Hillary Clinton
